page.title: 03Social Attitudes:Chinnor etc
page.content: Feelings about growth and 'belonging'. A survey was made was made by two Mill Lane Primary School classes. Most children and parents would not like to see Chinnor expand further; many people felt that the village had grown too quickly and was too large. Although the greater part of Chinnor was built during the last twenty years, bringing with it an influx of newcomers, there seems little resentment from the long-standing villagers. In fact, a very strong community feeling has developed and the social life illustrates this. In the two smaller villages of Sydenham and Emmington there is a strong feeling of 'belonging' both among newcomers and native residents. Some of the latter appear hardly affected by changes taking place in more urban areas.
